newsitem.title: USA: TBS change to generate $100 mln in revs-NYT.
newsitem.headline: TBS change to generate $100 mln in revs-NYT.

text.p: Turner Broadcasting System's transformation of its TBS superstation into what is essentially a basic cable network will generate as much as $100 million in new revenue in the next few years, The New York Times said.
Friday's edition said that Time Warner, Turner's parent company, told analysts that it expected the change to generate added revenue of $50 million by the end of 1998 and $100 million by 2000.
The projected revenue increase comes from the fact that TBS will able to collect subscriber fees as well as advertising dollars, the paper said.
